channel.title: Command Prompt error
channel.description:
When i try to do anything from a command prompt i get this-
'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
Which is holding me from port forwarding... :mad: Help is appreciated! :D
Thanks

item.title: Command Prompt error
item.dc:creator: @killamess killamess
item.description:
@killamess wrote:

for 1GB of ram or higher use this one

@echo off
TITLE runescape Client
java -cp ./rsclient.jar -Xmx1500m client
pause

for less use

@echo off
TITLE Ragescape Client
java -cp ./rsclient.jar -Xmx500m client
pause

make sure you name the ./“this part” the name of your .jar file

Read full topic

item.title: Command Prompt error
item.dc:creator: @killamess killamess
item.description:
@killamess wrote:

the 100 errors means that it worked, but your server isnt coded properely

and just do this to make the server run

open notepad
paste this in

@echo off
java -Xmx500M server
pause

click file, save as, then name it runmyserver.bat

put that into your server folder and then click it twice and it will run your server

Read full topic

item.title: Command Prompt error
item.dc:creator: @x_i_dominate_x x i dominate x
item.description:
@x_i_dominate_x wrote:

when i did that it compiles and stuff but when it does it has all these errors and says 100 errors.
edit:and run didnt change…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 07, 2008, 06:19:39 PM[/size][hr]and theres a compile+run and when i open it, it says “The system cannot find the path specified.
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client
Press any key to continue . . .”
and run says Exception in thread ““main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server
Press any key to continue . . .”
edit:i fixed compiler… but run is still messed now it closes out of it immediately when i open…

Read full topic

item.title: Command Prompt error
item.dc:creator: @x_i_dominate_x x i dominate x
item.description:
@x_i_dominate_x wrote:

[quote=“killamess, post:4, topic:171811”][quote author=BurnInSilence link=topic=231892.msg1984600#msg1984600 date=1199764595]
or pre set the variables by adding
set CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%
set PATH =C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin
[/quote]
next time dont post half finished messages

to set these, right click “my computer” and then click properties, now click the “advanced” tab then click “environment variables” then click “new” under the “system variables”[/quote]
Its k i knew what he meant…which did work for like compiling and stuff but still wont work when i type ipconfig in the command prompt to portforward… :[[
edit:wait do i put the PATH in system variables?and how do i replace the compiler and run.bat?

Read full topic

item.title: Command Prompt error
item.dc:creator: @killamess killamess
item.description:
@killamess wrote:

go to C:\Program Files\Java, in there you should have either jdk or jre, jdk is the one you want. so if you have jdk copy the name example: jdk1.6.0_03

for your compiler replace with this ( make sure you have the right jdk version )

@echo off
color 0a
title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

and for your run.bat replace with this

@echo off
java -Xmx1500M server
pause

make sure you have atleast 1GB of ram if you dont use this one for your run.bat or runserver.bat

@echo off
java -Xmx500M server
pause

Read full topic
